intro: Petlomelia dipetala, commonly known as the two-petaled beauty, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic and ornamental plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers with two petals, which are often brightly colored. Its leaves are simple and opposite, and it typically grows in shrubland or forest understory environments. The plant has both ornamental value and traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
